item.text: The Lord spoke to Moses:

“<st data-num="06213" class="">Make</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="08147" class="">two</st> <st data-num="02689" class="">trumpets</st> of <st data-num="03701">silver</st>; you are to <st data-num="06213" class="">make</st><n id="2" /> them from a single <st data-num="04749" class="">hammered piece</st>.<n id="3" /> You will <st data-num="01961" class="">use</st> them<n id="4" /> for <st data-num="04744" class="">assembling</st> the <st data-num="05712" class="">community</st> and for directing the <st data-num="04550" class="">traveling</st> of the <st data-num="04264" class="">camps</st>.
When they blow them both, all the community must come to you to the entrance of the tent of meeting.
“But if they blow with one trumpet, then the leaders, the heads of the thousands of Israel, must come to you.

When you <st data-num="08628" class="">blow</st> an <st data-num="08643" class="">alarm</st>,<n id="1" /> then the <st data-num="04264" class="">camps</st> that are <st data-num="02583" class="">located</st><n id="2" /> on the <st data-num="06924" class="">east side</st> must <st data-num="05265" class="">begin to travel</st>.<n id="3" />

And when you <st data-num="08628" class="">blow</st> an <st data-num="08643" class="">alarm</st> the <st data-num="08145" class="">second time</st>, then the <st data-num="04264" class="">camps</st> that are <st data-num="02583" class="">located</st> on the <st data-num="08486" class="">south side</st> must <st data-num="05265" class="">begin to travel</st>.<n id="1" /> An <st data-num="08643" class="">alarm</st> must be <st data-num="08628" class="">sounded</st><n id="2" /> for their <st data-num="04550" class="">journeys</st>.

But when you <st data-num="06950" class="">assemble</st> the <st data-num="06951" class="">community</st>,<n id="1" /> you must <st data-num="08628" class="">blow</st> the trumpets,<n id="2" /> but you must <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="07321" class="">sound an alarm</st>.<n id="3" />

The <st data-num="01121" class="">sons</st> of <st data-num="0175" class="">Aaron</st>, the <st data-num="03548" class="">priests</st>, must <st data-num="08628" class="">blow</st> the<st data-num="02689"> trumpets</st>, and they will <st data-num="01961" class="">be</st> to you for an <st data-num="05769" class="">eternal</st> <st data-num="02708" class="">ordinance</st> throughout your <st data-num="01755" class="">generations</st>.

If you go to war in your land against an adversary who opposes you, then you must sound an alarm with the trumpets, and you will be remembered before the Lord your God, and you will be saved from your enemies.

“Also, in the time when you rejoice, such as on your appointed festivals or at the beginnings of your months, you must blow with your trumpets over your burnt offerings and over the sacrifices of your peace offerings, so that they may become a memorial for you before your God: I am the Lord your God.”
On the twentieth day of the second month, in the second year, the cloud was taken up from the tabernacle of the testimony.
So the Israelites set out on their journeys from the desert of Sinai; and the cloud settled in the wilderness of Paran.
This was the first time they set out on their journey according to the commandment of the Lord, by the authority of Moses.
The standard of the camp of the Judahites set out first according to their companies, and over his company was Nahshon son of Amminadab.
Over the company of the tribe of Issacharites was Nathanel son of Zuar,

and <st data-num="05921" class="">over</st> the <st data-num="06635" class="">company</st> of the <st data-num="04294" class="">tribe</st> of the <st data-num="01121 02074">Zebulunites</st> was <st data-num="0446">Eliab</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> of <st data-num="02497" class="">Helon</st>.
Then the tabernacle was dismantled, and the sons of Gershon and the sons of Merari set out, carrying the tabernacle.
The standard of the camp of Reuben set out according to their companies; over his company was Elizur son of Shedeur.

<st data-num="05921" class="">Over</st> the <st data-num="06635" class="">company</st> of the <st data-num="04294" class="">tribe</st> of the <st data-num="01121 08095">Simeonites</st> was <st data-num="08017" class="">Shelumiel</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> of <st data-num="06701" class="">Zurishaddai</st>,

and <st data-num="05921" class="">over</st> the <st data-num="06635" class="">company</st> of the <st data-num="04294" class="">tribe</st> of the <st data-num="01121 01410">Gadites</st> was <st data-num="0460" class="">Eliasaph</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> of <st data-num="01845" class="">Deuel</st>.

And the <st data-num="06956" class="">Kohathites</st> <st data-num="05265" class="">set out</st>, <st data-num="05375" class="">carrying</st> the articles for the <st data-num="04720" class="">sanctuary</st>;<n id="1" /> the <st data-num="04908" class="">tabernacle</st> was to be <st data-num="06965" class="">set up</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="05704" class="">before</st> they <st data-num="0935" class="">arrived</st>.<n id="3" />

And the <st data-num="01714" class="">standard</st> of the <st data-num="04264" class="">camp</st> of the <st data-num="01121 0669">Ephraimites</st> <st data-num="05265" class="">set out</st> according to their <st data-num="06635" class="">companies</st>; <st data-num="05921" class="">over</st> his <st data-num="06635" class="">company</st> was <st data-num="0476" class="">Elishama</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> of <st data-num="05989" class="">Ammihud</st>.

<st data-num="05921" class="">Over</st> the <st data-num="06635" class="">company</st> of the <st data-num="04294" class="">tribe</st> of the <st data-num="01121 04519">Manassehites</st> was <st data-num="01583" class="">Gamaliel</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> of <st data-num="06301" class="">Pedahzur</st>,
and over the company of the tribe of Benjaminites was Abidan son of Gideoni.
The standard of the camp of the Danites set out, which was the rear guard of all the camps by their companies; over his company was Ahiezer son of Ammishaddai.

<st data-num="05921" class="">Over</st> the <st data-num="06635" class="">company</st> of the <st data-num="04294" class="">tribe</st> of the <st data-num="01121 0836">Asherites</st> was <st data-num="06295" class="">Pagiel</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> of <st data-num="05918" class="">Ocran</st>,

and <st data-num="05921" class="">over</st> the <st data-num="06635" class="">company</st> of the <st data-num="04294" class="">tribe</st> of the <st data-num="01121 05321">Naphtalites</st> was <st data-num="0299" class="">Ahira</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> of <st data-num="05881" class="">Enan</st>.
These were the traveling arrangements of the Israelites according to their companies when they traveled.

Moses said to Hobab son of Reuel, the Midianite, Moses’ father-in-law, “We are journeying to the place about which the Lord said, ‘I will give it to you.’ Come with us and we will treat you well, for the Lord has promised good things for Israel.”

But Hobab<n id="1" /> <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> him, “I will <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="01980" class="">go</st>, <st data-num="03588" class="">but</st> I will <st data-num="01980" class="">go</st> <st data-num="0518" class="">instead</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> my own <st data-num="0776" class="">land</st> and <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> my <st data-num="04138" class="">kindred</st>.”

Moses<n id="1" /> <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st>, “Do <st data-num="0408" class="">not</st> <st data-num="05800" class="">leave</st> us,<n id="2" /> <st data-num="03588 05921 03651">because</st> you <st data-num="03045" class="">know</st> <st data-num="02583" class="">places</st> for us <st data-num="02583" class="">to camp</st> in the <st data-num="04057" class="">wilderness</st>, and you could <st data-num="01961" class="">be</st> our <st data-num="05869" class="">guide</st>.<n id="3" />
And if you come with us, it is certain that whatever good things the Lord will favor us with, we will share with you as well.”
So they traveled from the mountain of the Lord three days’ journey; and the ark of the covenant of the Lord was traveling before them during the three days’ journey, to find a resting place for them.
And the cloud of the Lord was over them by day, when they traveled from the camp.
And when the ark traveled, Moses would say, “Rise up, O Lord! May your enemies be scattered, and may those who hate you flee before you!”
And when it came to rest he would say, “Return, O Lord, to the many thousands of Israel!”
